TextView.android:text: JUPITER- The Fifth Planet from the Sun

Basic Information:
Type: Gas Giant
Order from Sun: 5th planet
Distance from Sun: ~778.5 million km (~5.2 AU)
Diameter: 139,820 km (largest planet in the Solar System)
Mass: ~1.898 × 10^27 kg (about 318 times Earth's mass)
Gravity: 24.79 m/s² (2.5 times Earth's gravity)

Orbital And Rotational Characteristics:
Revolution period (around Sun): 11.86 Earth years
Rotation period (on its own axis): 9.93 hours (fastest rotation among planets)
Orbital Speed: 13.07 km/s
Axial Tilt: 3.13° (mild seasons)
Orbital Eccentricity: 0.0489

Moons And Rings:
Number of Moons: 95 (including Ganymede, the largest moon in the Solar System)
Number of Rings: 4 (faint ring system)

Surface And Atmosphere:
Surface Temperature: ~ -145°C (-234°F)
Surface Composition: No solid surface, composed mainly of hydrogen and helium
Atmosphere Type: Thick and stormy
Main Gases in Atmosphere: Hydrogen (H₂), Helium (He), Methane (CH₄), Ammonia (NH₃)
Weather Conditions: Extreme storms, including the Great Red Spot (a massive storm larger than Earth)
